arm_group.description: Corn/soy oil placebo capsules that are similar in shape and color to the DHA capsules given over 10 weeks
Long-chain omega-3 fatty acid docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) at 1,200 mg/day, 600 mg twice daily for 10 weeks

brief_summary.textblock:
The study hypothesis is that DHA is more effective than placebo in increasing brain
      activation and reducing symptoms in psychostimulant-naive children with ADHD.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Omega-3 Fatty Acid on Cortical Function in ADHD

detailed_description.textblock:
This study aims to determine the effects of 10-week dietary supplementation with the
      long-chain omega-3 fatty acid docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) or placebo on prefrontal cortical
      structural and functional connectivity using several neuroimaging techniques: DTI (Diffusion
      Tensor Imaging), 1H MRS(Proton Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy), and fMRI (Functional
      Magnetic Resonance Imaging) in psychostimulant-naive children with attention deficit
      hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). It is postulated that DHA supplements will increase brain
      activation and reduce ADHD symptomatology.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Provision of written informed consent/assent

          -  Ages 8-12 years old

          -  Male gender

          -  Meets DSM-IV-TR criteria for ADHD (combined type) as determined by the KSADS

          -  Right handed determined by the Crovitz Handedness Questionnaire

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Contraindication to an MRI scan (i.e., braces, claustrophobia)

          -  A history of a major medical (e.g., diabetes) or neurological illness (e.g.,
             epilepsy)

          -  Previous exposure to stimulant medications

          -  Greater than 1 year outside appropriate age/grade level

          -  A history of intolerance or hypersensitivity to omega-3 fatty acids

          -  Currently taking omega-3 supplements

          -  Not proficient in English language

          -  Any history of a hematological disorder or concomitant use of anticoagulant
             medications

          -  Personal history of an Axis I psychiatric disorder other than ADHD

intervention.description: Patients will receive a fixed dose of DHA (1,200 mg/day, 600 mg twice daily) or placebo (corn/soy oil) over 10 weeks
corn/soy oil capsule with similar color, taste, and shape as experimental drug (DHA)

facility.name: University of Cincinnati, Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Neuroscience

clinical_study.official_title: Docosahexaenoic Acid Augmentation of Cortical Attention Networks in ADHD

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Clinical improvement as measured by the ADHD Rating Scale

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Prefrontal cortical structural and functional connectivity measures

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
